item.title: Rubbish left by bin in Pickhurst park near Heath Rise, 17th January
item.description:

item.title: Rubbish at the hoveton road bus stop-need a permanent bin, 17th January
item.description:
**Subject: Urgent Request for Clean‑Up and Installation of a Bin at Hoveton Road Bus Stop** Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to raise a concern about the persistent build‑up of rubbish around the bus stop on Hoveton Road in Thamesmead. The area has become increasingly unsightly, with litter accumulating on the pavement, grass verge, and around the shelter. This not only creates an unpleasant environment for residents and bus users, but also attracts pests and undermines the appearance of the neighbourhood. Despite regular footfall and heavy use of this stop, there is **no bin provided**, which contributes significantly to the problem. Many people would dispose of their waste responsibly if a bin were available. The absence of one makes it difficult to keep the area clean and places an unnecessary burden on the community. I am requesting the following actions: - A prompt clean‑up of the rubbish currently surrounding the bus stop - An assessment and installation of a **permanent litter bin** at this location to prevent ongoing issues These improvements would make a noticeable difference to the local environment and the daily experience of residents who rely on this bus stop. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to seeing action taken to improve the upkeep of this important public space.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Crossway, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large hole in the road, 17th January
item.description:
I am making a complaint and claim To be refunded for the damage caused to my vehicle because of a large hole in the road The incident occurred on Thursday 16th January at approximately 3pm - My journey took a traumatic turn when my car was seriously damaged because of a large hole in the road. I was Driving along this road as I usually would - weather conditions on this day meant poor visibility - and this stretch of road is slightly uphill - Then suddenly I was victim to driving over a large hole in the road that I could not of seen in such conditions. What happened took me off the road completely and most definitely could have caused a very serious accident. I went back the next day to take photo Evidence of the place the incident occurred - By this time This huge hazard had been made safer so people Could actually see how Dangerous this was - Which did not help me from the day before - When the hole was left open and so very dangerous I had trauma from the previous day -My whole afternoon was ruined my car was not useable and it cost me a lot of money to be repaired. Completely flat tyre, damaged wheel, £360 repairs - a copy Of the receipt is attached. I request to be refunded for the damage caused to my vechile.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkhill Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
